messages: 0a39f78bcb297ab0ebe8a29c28bfed89 (14:27): bugmail: [Bug 9452] Handling of additional tracks of a multitrack audio/video resource <http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/public-html-bugzilla/2010Sep/0496.html> ** [Bug 10598] New: Net schlecht her specht <http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/public-html-bugzilla/2010Sep/0495.html>
60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28 (14:31): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2, do we have a rule about who can remove "TrackerRequest" keywords from issues?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:31): yeah
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:31): the rule is, don't
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:32): did somebody do that?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:32): <sigh>
60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28 (14:32): is this a trick question?
60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28 (14:33): http://www.w3.org/Bugs/Public/show_activity.cgi?id=10399
0a39f78bcb297ab0ebe8a29c28bfed89 (14:33): Title: Changes made to bug 10399 (at www.w3.org)
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:33): I see
60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28 (14:33): is there a way to run a query on bugzilla checking for other instances?
60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28 (14:33): Where keywords were removed?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:34): not through the Web UI, no
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:34): not that I know of at least
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:34): maybe some way that we can do it with SQL query to the DB
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:35): but anyway, I think it would be overkill to resort to that
60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28 (14:35): hopefully this was a singular case
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:35): this case seems singular in a lot of ways
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (14:36): it was also not silently removed
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:36): do you really want this issue to be brought to attention of the chairs and the group at this point?
60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28 (14:36): with "silently" I mean no comment was added
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (14:37): a comment was added
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (14:37): see the date of the change and the date of comment 8
60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28 (14:37): Maciej already volunteered in yesterday's telco to follow up
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (14:37): they are *identical*
60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28 (14:37): that's the only reason why I was checking the bug's state
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (14:37): see also the email in the logs
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (14:37): e.g. on public-html-bugzilla
60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28 (14:39): indeed, I didn't notice the removal of the keyword yesterday, because i didn't anticipate Ian doing that
60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28 (14:39): so I was wrong about the "silently"
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (14:40): if you wanted to say do not remove keywords you should have said that
60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28 (14:42): I wanted to say what I said. I was wrong about one part of my complaint. Things like that happen.
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:42): 60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28, I personally recognize that bug 10399 is a legitimate bug
0a39f78bcb297ab0ebe8a29c28bfed89 (14:42): http://www.w3.org/Bugs/Public/show_bug.cgi?id=10399 <email/>, P2, RESOLVED INVALID, base64 def in algorithm for put to data URI
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:42): 60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28, I just think that in the grand scheme of things, it does not seem like a particularly high priority *at this point*
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:42): when we are trying to get ready for LC
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:43): that bug is not going to slip through the cracks in the long term
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:43): maybe it would help if I create another keyword
60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28 (14:44): well, it might if it's in state "resolved" and people remove keywords
60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28 (14:44): like "don't-mess-with-Mike's-keywords"?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:45): well, I mean the comment of the bug itself

a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:45): we could have another keyword which would have the semantics of, "It is perhaps not important enough to raise an Issue for this now, but this should be addressed before we move to CR|PR"
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:46): which I would suggest that this issue might fall into
60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28 (14:46): Usually, bugs like that are simply left open; it doesn't make sense to mark something resolved when it isn't...
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:46): that is, this can wait
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:46): wait to be fixed until quite a while later
60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28 (14:46): or of course it could be fixed right away, instead of eating up our time :-)
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:46): well, our bugzilla "resolved" state does not mean "resolved"
60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28 (14:46): yes, that's a problem
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:47): of course it could also be not raised to begin with at this point
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:47): one option is, being more selective about what bugs you raise at this point
60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28 (14:47): sorry Mike, that doesn't compute.
60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28 (14:48): if it's necessary to raise bugzilla issues to get editorial fixes in, that's what I'll do
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:48): a bug in our bugzilla is a request for action by the editor
60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28 (14:48): and this, btw, is also what Ian is asking for.
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:48): it is not necessary for every editorial but to be fixed before we go to LC
60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28 (14:48): that may be truue
60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28 (14:49): but problems should be reported
60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28 (14:49): and if they don't get fixed right away there needs to be a way to find out what#s left to do

a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:49): if it gets to the point where an editorial bug is resulting in you and the editor both wasting more time on it than it deserves, that is a net loss for both of you
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:49): bingo
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:49): what you just said
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:49): "there needs to be a way to find out what#s left to do"
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:50): so we can mint a keyword for that state
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:50): or something
60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28 (14:50): so having a keyword that says "this is *not* resolved, although Bugzilla says it is" would be helpful
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:50): I just do not think it is to the benefit of any of us to allow editorial bugs to spiral into becoming Issues
60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28 (14:51): yes, that's why I didn't so far
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:51): imagining that "resolved" is an opaque string that has whatever meaning we choose to give it is another part of the solution
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:51): because that is what it is
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:52): the set of default states in bugzilla is unfortunately suboptimal
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:52): it may be that we should just add a new state
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:53): since others seem to be hung up on that word also
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:53): but adding a new state adds that state globally in bugzilla
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:53): so that affects all W3C users of bugzilla, across all WGs
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:54): so it is not something I can do without getting signoff from others at w3C outside the group
60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28 (14:54): yes, that's not pretty
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:54): yeah
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:54): bikeshed waiting to happen
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:54): so I need to talk with chairs about this
60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28 (14:54): that's why I link ultra simple bug trackers where nothing can be configured :-)
60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28 (14:55): I think this was the case for early versions of cvstrac
60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28 (14:55): lots of meta discussions avoided
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:55): there is more complexity in bugzilla than we need, that's for sure
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:56): but there is also not enough of what we do need
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:56): bugzilla maintainers actually made some updates based on feedback they had gotten from us
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:56): they contacted us a year or so ago, iirc
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:57): and asked what changes we thought would be useful to make for whatever the latest major release was

0a39f78bcb297ab0ebe8a29c28bfed89 (14:57): bugmail: "[Bug 9659] Initial U+0000 should not set frameset-ok to "not ok"" (2 messages in thread) <http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/public-html-bugzilla/2010Sep/0505.html> ** "[Bug 10399] base64 def in algorithm for put to data URI" (2 messages in thread) <http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/public-html-bugzilla/2010Sep/0503.html> ** "[Bug 9659] Initial U+0000 should not set frameset-ok to "not ok"" (2 messages in thread) <http://lists.

a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:59): anyway, 60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28, to get back to the task at hand: If I were for now at least to add an additional keyword along the lines of what we have discussed, can you suggest a name?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (15:00): LGTM
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (15:00): I will see if that is in their now
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (15:00): *there

60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28 (15:01): http://www.w3.org/Search/Mail/Public/advanced_search?keywords=%22Keywords|TrackerRequest%22+Hickson&hdr-1-name=subject&hdr-1-query=&hdr-2-name=from&hdr-2-query=&hdr-3-name=message-id&hdr-3-query=&period_month=&period_year=&index-grp=Public__FULL&index-type=t&type-index=public-html-bugzilla&resultsperpage=20&sortby=date
0a39f78bcb297ab0ebe8a29c28bfed89 (15:01): Title: W3C mailing-list search service (at www.w3.org)
60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28 (15:01): that makes me feel better
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (15:01): ah yeah, I had not thought of searching the mailing list
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (15:02): = looks good to me
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (15:02): 60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28: so I can add TODO now -- but I need a one-sentence description of the semantics
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (15:02): suggestion for that?
60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28 (15:04): I think we could use RESOLVED/LATER
60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28 (15:04): but I'm sure in this case the editor would object to the state
60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28 (15:05): What I want is "TODO" == "This is bug that needs to be fixed at some point of time"
60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28 (15:06): it would be much saner to get this simply fixed
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (15:07): a lot of things would arguably be saner than the way we are doing them
60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28 (15:08): I'll print that out and let you sign that the next time we meet
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (15:09): I will sign it in blood
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (15:09): or better yet, I will get a tattoo that say that
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (15:10): in gothic letters
60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28 (15:10): And I'll get a T-Shirt saying "don't mess with my tracker requests"
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (15:10): yeah
60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28 (15:11): so that I have something to change for day 2 (day 1: "Larry eats babies")
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (15:11): this WG cries out for some xtranormal.com videos
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (15:12): when I get some time, I am going to make some
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (15:12): no wait
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (15:12): I lie
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (15:12): I'm not going to make any
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (15:12): but somebody probably will
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (15:13): somebody
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (15:17): 60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28: keyword added
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (15:17): http://www.w3.org/Bugs/Public/describekeywords.cgi
0a39f78bcb297ab0ebe8a29c28bfed89 (15:17): Title: Bugzilla Keyword Descriptions (at www.w3.org)
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (15:18): I will talk to the chairs about getting it added to the decision-policy doc
0a39f78bcb297ab0ebe8a29c28bfed89 (15:18): http://www.w3.org/Bugs/Public/show_bug.cgi?id=9659 <email/>, P1, REOPENED, Initial U+0000 should not set frameset-ok to "not ok"

0a39f78bcb297ab0ebe8a29c28bfed89 (15:27): bugmail: [Bug 10399] base64 def in algorithm for put to data URI <http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/public-html-bugzilla/2010Sep/0507.html> ** [Bug 10418] Scoping element inside e.g. <mi> causes insertion mode to switch to secondary insertion mode too early <http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/public-html-bugzilla/2010Sep/0506.html>
